paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V122I, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis with length-dependent sensorimotor neuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis and length-dependent sensorimotor neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: At this time, it was also revealed that the patient’s daughter had a long-standing history of idiopathic cardiomyopathy prompting genetic testing. The diagnosis of length-dependent sensorimotor neuropathy was subsequently made, and genetic testing confirmed heterozygous TTR mutation (V122I gene mutation).

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant is associated with transthyretin amyloidosis, affecting protein stability and function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is present in the patient and his daughter, suggesting familial inheritance.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is linked to hereditary amyloidosis.
key_quotes: genetic testing confirmed heterozygous TTR mutation (V122I gene mutation)

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data is comprehensive based on the available text.
